title: Calories in Steamed Shrimp
meta_description: Discover calories in steamed shrimp per 100 g, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown for easy tracking.
assumptions: Fresh, medium-sized shrimp, steamed without added oil, butter, or salt; peeled and deveined.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by shrimp size, freshness, cooking time, and added seasonings. Check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of steamed shrimp provides about 99 kcal and 24 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Shell-on (vs. peeled) per 100 g edible portion
With garlic and lemon seasoning (minimal calories)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g steamed shrimp?
faqs.a: Approximately 99 kcal for plain steamed shrimp.

faqs.q: Is steamed shrimp high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, about 24 g protein per 100 g, making it a lean source.

faqs.q: Does steaming add calories to shrimp?
faqs.a: No, plain steaming keeps it low-cal; additions like oil increase it.

faqs.q: What about cholesterol in steamed shrimp?
faqs.a: Around 161 mg per 100 g, mostly from natural shellfish content.

faqs.q: How does sodium vary in steamed shrimp?
faqs.a: Low at 119 mg per 100 g without salt; added seasonings raise it.
